io.permazen.core

Class FieldTypeRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.core.FieldTypeRegistry

  • public class FieldTypeRegistry
extends Object
    A registry of FieldTypes.

    All FieldTypes in a FieldTypeRegistry are registered under a unique type name. However, multiple registered FieldTypes may support the same Java type.

    Arrays

    Array types will be automatically created and registered on demand, assuming the base element type is already registered.

    Arrays are passed by value: i.e., the entire array is copied. Therefore, changes to array elements after getting or setting a field have no effect on the field's value.

    Arrays of references are not currently supported.

    Built-in Types

    The following types are automatically registered (or generated on demand):

    • Primitive types (boolean, int, etc.)
    • Primitive wrapper types (Boolean, Integer, etc.)
    • String
    • Array types
    • Enum types
    • BigDecimal
    • BigInteger
    • BitSet
    • Date
    • UUID
    • URI
    • File
    • InetAddress
    • Inet4Address
    • Inet6Address
    • Pattern
    • InternetAddress
    • java.time.*

    • Constructor Detail

      • FieldTypeRegistry

        public FieldTypeRegistry()
        Constructor. Creates an instance with all of the pre-defined FieldTypes (e.g., for types such as primitive types, String, etc.) already registered.

    • Method Detail

      • addNamedClasses

        public void addNamedClasses(Iterable<String> classNames)
        Add multiple user-defined FieldType to this registry, using newly created instances of the named classes.
        Parameters:
        classNames - names of classes that implement FieldType
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if classNames is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if classNames contains an invalid FieldType class
        RuntimeException - if instantiation of a class fails

      • addClasses

        public void addClasses(Iterable<? extends Class<? extends FieldType<?>>> classes)
        Add multiple user-defined FieldType to this registry, using newly created instances of the specified classes.
        Parameters:
        classes - implementations of types to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes contains a null class or a class with invalid annotation(s)
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes contains an invalid FieldType class

      • addClass

        public void addClass(Class<? extends FieldType<?>> typeClass)
        Add a user-defined FieldType to this registry, using a newly created instance of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        typeClass - implementation of type to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if typeClass is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if typeClass cannot be instantiated
        IllegalArgumentException - if the type name conflicts with an existing type
        IllegalArgumentException - if the type name ends with [] (array name)

      • add

        public boolean add(FieldType<?> type)
        Add a user-defined FieldType to the registry.
        Parameters:
        type - type to add
        Returns:
        true if type was added, false if type was already registered
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if type has a name that conflicts with an existing, but different, type
        IllegalArgumentException - if type has a name that ends with [] (array name)

      • getFieldType

        public FieldType<?> getFieldType(String name)
        Get the FieldType with the given name in this registry.

        Convenience method, equivalent to:

        getFieldType(name, 0L)
        Parameters:
        name - type name
        Returns:
        type with name name, or null if not found
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null

      • getFieldType

        public FieldType<?> getFieldType(String name,
                                 long signature)
        Get the FieldType with the given name and encoding signature in this registry.
        Parameters:
        name - type name
        signature - type encoding signature
        Returns:
        type with name name, or null if not found
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null

      • getArrayType

        public <E> FieldType<E[]> getArrayType(FieldType<E> elementType)
        Get the array FieldType with the given element type.
        Type Parameters:
        E - array element type
        Parameters:
        elementType - array element type
        Returns:
        array type with element type elementType
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elementType is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the resulting array type has too many dimensions

      • getFieldTypes

        public <T> List<FieldType<T>> getFieldTypes(TypeToken<T> typeToken)
        Get all FieldTypes in this registry that supports values of the given Java type, which must exactly match the FieldType's supported Java type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - field value type
        Parameters:
        typeToken - field value type
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of FieldTypes supporting Java values of type typeToken
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if typeToken is null

      • getFieldType

        public <T> FieldType<T> getFieldType(TypeToken<T> typeToken)
        Get the unique FieldType in this registry that supports values of the given Java type, which must exactly match the FieldType's supported Java type. There must be exactly one such FieldType, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - field value type
        Parameters:
        typeToken - field value type
        Returns:
        FieldType supporting Java values of type typeToken
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if typeToken is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if no registered FieldTypes supports typeToken
        IllegalArgumentException - if more than one registered FieldType supports typeToken

      • getAll

        public List<FieldType<?>> getAll()
        Get all types registered with this instance.
        Returns:
        all registered types
